column7: The Acl package contains utilities to administer Access Control Lists
The Attr package contains utilities to administer the extended attributes of filesystem objects
Autoconf is an extensible package of M4 macros that produce shell scripts to automatically configure software source code
The Automake package contains programs for generating Makefiles for use with Autoconf
bash is the GNU Bourne again shell
bc is an arbitrary precision numeric processing language
The GNU Binutils are a collection of binary tools including a linker and an assembler
GNU Bison is a general purpose parser-generator
bzip2 is a freely available patent free high-quality data compressor
These are the core utilities which are expected to exist on every operating system
curl is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URLs
The Debian Almquist shell
The DejaGnu package contains a framework for running test suites on GNU tools
GNU Diffutils is a package of several programs related to finding differences between files
Utilities for administrating the ext2 ext3 and ext4 file systems
Expat is a stream-oriented XML parser library written in C
Expect is a tool for automating interactive applications via scripted dialogues
file is a utility which guesses a file's type based on its content
GNU Find Utilities are the basic directory searching utilities
Flex is a tool for generating scanners
GNU implementation of the AWK text processor
gcc is the GNU Compiler Collection
GNU dbm is a library of database functions that use extensible hashing
The GNU Gettext package contains utilities and libraries for internationalization and localization
git is a free and open source distributed version control system
glibc is the GNU C library
gmp is the GNU Multiple Precision arithmetic library
GNU gperf is a perfect hash function generator
Grep searches one or more input files for lines containing a match to a specified pattern
GNU roff is a typesetting system that reads plain text input to produce output in PostScript PDF HTML or DVI formats
GNU GRUB is a Multiboot boot loader. It was derived from GRUB the GRand Unified Bootloader
Standard GNU compression utility
GNU inetutils is a collection of common network programs including telnet ping hostname and ifconfig
inih (INI Not Invented Here) is a simple .INI file parser written in C. It's only a couple of pages of code and was designed to be small and simple
Iproute2 is a collection of utilities for controlling TCP/IP networking and traffic control in Linux
kbd contains tools for managing the Linux console by loading fonts and keyboard maps
he Kmod package contains libraries and utilities for loading kernel modules
The Libcap package implements the userspace interface to the POSIX 1003.1e capabilities available in Linux kernels
The Libffi library allows a program written in one language to call a program written in another language
Libidn's purpose is to encode and decode internationalized domain names
libpipeline is a C library for manipulating pipelines of subprocesses in a flexible and convenient way
libpsl is a C library to handle the Public Suffix List
libssh2 is a client-side C library implementing the SSH2 protocol
GNU Libtool is a generic library support script that hides the complexity of using shared libraries
This library provides functions for manipulating Unicode strings and for manipulating C strings according to the Unicode standard
liburcu is a LGPLv2.1 userspace RCU (read-copy-update) library that provides read-side access which scales linearly with the number of cores
The Libxcrypt package contains a modern library for one-way hashing of passwords
Less is a free open-source file pager for the command line interface
Lz4 is a lossless compression algorithm
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and other non-source files of a program from the program's source files
The Man-DB package contains programs for finding and viewing man pages
GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor
GNU MPC is a C library for the arithmetic of complex numbers with arbitrarily high precision
The MPFR library is a C library for multiple-precision floating-point computations with correct rounding
GNU nano is a small and fast command line text editor
The Ncurses package contains libraries for terminal-independent handling of character screens
OpenSSH is the premier connectivity tool for remote login with the SSH protocol
The OpenSSL package contains management tools and libraries relating to cryptography
Patch takes a patch file containing a difference listing produced by the diff program and applies those differences to one or more original files
Perl is a highly capable feature-rich programming language with over 36 years of development
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags for development libraries
The procps-ng package contains programs for monitoring processes.
psmisc provides a handful of utilities that use the proc file-system including fuser pstree and killall
The Python interpreted computer language
readline is a console display library
Ruby is a dynamic open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity
sed (stream editor) is a non-interactive command-line text editor
The Shadow package contains programs for handling passwords in a secure way
The Sysklogd package contains programs for logging system messages
The GNU archive tool
Tcl is the Tool Command Language; a robust general-purpose scripting language
C shell with file name completion and command line editing
util-linux is a suite of essential utilities for any Linux system
vim is a highly configurable text editor built to make creating and changing any kind of text very efficient
wget is a scriptable utility for downloading files over multiple protocols
Utilities for administrating the xfs filesystem
The XML::Parser module is a Perl interface to Expat
Compress or decompress .xz and .lzma files
Standard unencumbered compression/decompression library
zsh is an interactive shell and powerful scripting language
Zstandard is a real-time compression algorithm
